Cell structure of protozoa: Unicellular or Acellular with one or more nuclei
General features.Grade or organization: Protoplasmic level of body organization/ Acellular/ Molecular level of body organization.

data: No locomotory organelles (Gliding or bending movements)
Mostly freeliving found freshwater and marine environments, few parasitic and pathogenic
Mostly freeliving found freshwater and marine environments, few parasitic and pathogenic
Both free-living and parasitic, found in various aquatic habitats
Entirely parasitic, found inside host organisms
Usually one nucleus, though multinucleate forms exist
Two types of nuclei (Macronucleus and Micronucleus)
Usually one or two nuclei, can be multinucleate
Absorption through general body surface or cytostome
Absorption directly from the host cells

__mcq.qu: Locomotory organ is absent in class
__mcq.sol: Sporozoan class of Protozoa does not have any locomotory organ.

__mcq.qu: Classification of Protozoa is on the basis of
__mcq.sol: Classification of Protozoa is on the basis of Locomotory organ.

Parasitic protozoans.<i>Giardia lamblia</i>: Inhabits in crypts of Duodenum and Upper part of jejunum of man.
Parasitic protozoans.<i>Balantidium</i>: Resides in the Large intestine, similar to Entamoeba histolytica.
Parasitic protozoans.<i>Trypansoma</i>: Resides in Blood lymph, spleen, CNS and Cerebrospinal fluid.
Parasitic protozoans.<i>Trichomonas</i>: Resides in Genital tract and causes Vaginitis.

Body covering.Radiolarians: Continuous internal skeleton between ectoplasm and endoplasm is found.

Locomotion: Protozoan class that does not carry its name after locomotory organ is Sporozoa.

Nuclear dimorphism: Nuclear dimorphism means nucleus varies from one to several.

data: Osmoregulation takes place in fresh water protozoan with the help of one or two contractile vacuoles which is absent in marine and parasitic protozoans.
When a fresh water Amoeba is kept in sea water, it loses its contractile vacuole but when a marine Amoeba is kept in fresh water, it develops contractile vacuole.
Gaseous exchange takes place by diffusion through general body surface.

Excretion: Excretion takes place through general body surface.

Reproduction.__p: Reproduction in protozoa may be asexual or sexual.

data: Binary fission of a multinucleated protozoa into two or more smaller multinucleate daughter individuals is termed as Plasmotomy.

Budding.__p: Budding is a modified binary fission resulting in a single or many daughter individuals in addition to the parent.

Sexual reproduction.Syngamy: Syngamy is fusion of two sex cells.
Sexual reproduction.Conjugation: Conjugation is temporary contact of two individuals with nuclear exchange.

data: In most protozoa, sexually mature individual is haploid.
Many protozoans form cyst which help them in overcoming unfavourable conditions and cause dispersal.

Trichonympha: Trichonympha is symbiotic protozoan found in gut of the termite helping in cellulose digestion.
data.Monocystis: Monocystis is parasite in the seminal vesicle of Earthworm.
data.Opalina: Opalina is found in Rectum (Small intestine) of Frog.
